trans-unit.source: Change the Azure Active Directory tenant in Azure RemoteApp
trans-unit.target: Change the Azure Active Directory tenant in Azure RemoteApp

trans-unit.source: Azure RemoteApp uses Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) to allow user access.
trans-unit.target: Azure RemoteApp uses Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) to allow user access.

trans-unit.source: The only Azure AD tenant that you can use is the one associated with the Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: The only Azure AD tenant that you can use is the one associated with the Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: You can view the associated subscription on the Settings page in the portal.
trans-unit.target: You can view the associated subscription on the Settings page in the portal.

trans-unit.source: Look at the Directory column on the Subscriptions tab.
trans-unit.target: Look at the Directory column on the Subscriptions tab.

trans-unit.source: For this change to succeed, first remove all users from the existing Azure Active Directory tenant from all Azure RemoteApp collections.
trans-unit.target: For this change to succeed, first remove all users from the existing Azure Active Directory tenant from all Azure RemoteApp collections.

trans-unit.source: To do this, go to the Azure Portal, go to the Azure RemoteApp tab and open every Azure RemoteApp collection.
trans-unit.target: To do this, go to the Azure Portal, go to the Azure RemoteApp tab and open every Azure RemoteApp collection.

trans-unit.source: Go to the Users tab and remove users that belong to your current Azure Active Directory tenant.
trans-unit.target: Go to the Users tab and remove users that belong to your current Azure Active Directory tenant.

trans-unit.source: Repeat for all existing Azure RemoteApp collections.
trans-unit.target: Repeat for all existing Azure RemoteApp collections.

trans-unit.source: Without doing this, you will not be able to create or patch collections.
trans-unit.target: Without doing this, you will not be able to create or patch collections.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use a different tenant, use these steps to change the association with your subscription:
trans-unit.target: If you want to use a different tenant, use these steps to change the association with your subscription:

trans-unit.source: In the portal, remove any Azure AD users to which you’ve given access to Azure RemoteApp collections.
trans-unit.target: In the portal, remove any Azure AD users to which you’ve given access to Azure RemoteApp collections.

trans-unit.source: Set a Microsoft account (formerly called a Live ID) as the Service Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Set a Microsoft account (formerly called a Live ID) as the Service Administrator.

trans-unit.source: (Look at Settings -> Administrators.)
trans-unit.target: (Look at Settings -> Administrators.)

trans-unit.source: Click the currently logged in user in the upper right corner, and then click View my bill.
trans-unit.target: Click the currently logged in user in the upper right corner, and then click View my bill.

trans-unit.source: Select your subscription, and then click Edit subscription details.
trans-unit.target: Select your subscription, and then click Edit subscription details.

trans-unit.source: Make the changes necessary.
trans-unit.target: Make the changes necessary.

trans-unit.source: Sign out of the portal, and then sign back in with the Microsoft account you specified in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: Sign out of the portal, and then sign back in with the Microsoft account you specified in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Click New -> App Services -> Active Directory -> Custom Create -> Use Existing Directory.
trans-unit.target: Click New -> App Services -> Active Directory -> Custom Create -> Use Existing Directory.

trans-unit.source: Add the Azure AD tenant that you want to associate with this subscription.
trans-unit.target: Add the Azure AD tenant that you want to associate with this subscription.

trans-unit.source: Under Settings -> Subscriptions, select your subscription, and then click Edit Directory.
trans-unit.target: Under Settings -> Subscriptions, select your subscription, and then click Edit Directory.

trans-unit.source: Select the Azure AD tenant that you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Select the Azure AD tenant that you want to use.

trans-unit.source: You can now use the new Azure AD tenant to control access to the Azure subscription and to configure user access in Azure RemoteApp.
trans-unit.target: You can now use the new Azure AD tenant to control access to the Azure subscription and to configure user access in Azure RemoteApp.
